data.headline: S&P 500 closed up 0.24% after early gains faded, while Dow and Nasdaq finished near flat
bullets: Russell 2000 underperformed, dropping about 0.7% as small caps lagged broader market
January jobs report came in stronger than expected, boosting Treasury yields and easing recession fears
Robust payroll gains and lower unemployment tempered hopes for near-term Fed rate cuts
Growth, AI, and small cap stocks saw outflows amid ongoing software sector weakness
Vertiv surged after beating Q4 expectations and issuing strong forward guidance
Moderna declined following an FDA rejection, adding to sector-specific volatility
